intro: Senecio spegazzinii, commonly known as the Spegazzini's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in a cluster. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
